bug.author: cheyang
bug.summary: Failed to copy files through fuse client, alluxio worker in the same node crashed
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: 2.0.0-snapshot Describe the bug Deploy master, workers and fuse in Kubernetes. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/files/3308053/k8s.zip>k8s.zip</denchmark-link>
And go to the machine A(192.168.0.109), copy whole the directory from alluxio to local directory <denchmark-code>time cp -r /alluxio-fuse/training-data/images /var/lib/docker/test cp: failed to extend ‘/var/lib/docker/test/images/train-00304-of-01024’: Input/output error cp: error reading ‘/alluxio-fuse/training-data/images/train-00475-of-01024’: Input/output error cp: failed to extend ‘/var/lib/docker/test/images/train-00475-of-01024’: Input/output error
real 30m26.516s user 0m0.314s sys 0m35.239s
</denchmark-code>
And I notice the alluxio worker in the same node restarted twice: <denchmark-code>kubectl get po -owide NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE IP NODE NOMINATED NODE NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE alluxio-fuse-6n8rx 1/1 Running 0 33m alluxio-fuse-fgwwc 1/1 Running 0 33m alluxio-fuse-fk6nz 1/1 Running 0 33m alluxio-fuse-j7w4w 1/1 Running 0 33m alluxio-master-0 2/2 Running 0 35m alluxio-worker-4fzk5 2/2 Running 0 34m alluxio-worker-4lv85 2/2 Running 0 34m alluxio-worker-5j784 2/2 Running 1 34m alluxio-worker-nww66 2/2 Running 0 34m </denchmark-code>
check the logs of the worker alluxio-worker-l9dww: <denchmark-code>Jun 19, 2019 9:44:04 PM io.grpc.netty.NettyServerHandler onStreamError WARNING: Stream Error # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # SIGBUS (0x7) at pc=0x00007f6db3c60225, pid=247, tid=0x00007f6d6a65fae8 # # JRE version: OpenJDK Runtime Environment (8.0_151-b12) (build 1.8.0_151-b12) # Java VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (25.151-b12 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops) # Derivative: IcedTea 3.6.0 # Distribution: Custom build (Tue Nov 21 11:22:36 GMT 2017) # Problematic frame: # V [libjvm.so+0x4de225] JVM_FindSignal+0x6c034 # # Core dump written. Default location: /opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/core or core.247 # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # /opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/hs_err_pid247.log integration/docker/bin/alluxio-worker.sh: line 34: 247 Segmentation fault (core dumped) ${JAVA} -cp ${ALLUXIO_SERVER_CLASSPATH} ${ALLUXIO_WORKER_JAVA_OPTS} alluxio.worker.AlluxioWorker </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ggezer>@ggezer</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bf8086>@bf8086</denchmark-link> do you have any insights into the error?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cheyang>@cheyang</denchmark-link> It is possible that worker crashed due to out of memory. Can you increase the memory for the worker container and try again?

io.netty.handler.codec.http2.Http2Exception$StreamException: Received DATA frame for an unknown stream error happens when a data stream is not terminated properly. It's usually benign and caused by underlying stream handling by gRPC. Relevant trace to your problem is most possibly: 2019-06-19 22:03:20,743 WARN UnderFileSystemBlockReader - Failed to cache data read from UFS (on transferTo()): No space left on device

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ggezer>@ggezer</denchmark-link> , thank you for spotting this. I'm curious that I've already configured <denchmark-code>ALLUXIO_JAVA_OPTS=-Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=SSD -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.path=/var/lib/docker/alluxio -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.quota=500GB -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.high.ratio=0.9 -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.low.ratio=0.7
</denchmark-code>
And here is the command line of the master. I noticed it has the two same key alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias. <denchmark-code>/usr/bin/java -cp /opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/conf/::/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/assembly/alluxio-server-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar -Dalluxio.master.hostname=alluxio-master -Dalluxio.master.journal.type=UFS -Dalluxio.master.journal.folder=/journal -Dalluxio.worker.data.server.domain.socket.address=/opt/domain -Dalluxio.worker.data.server.domain.socket.as.uuid=true -Dalluxio.master.port=19998 -Dalluxio.master.web.port=19999 -Dalluxio.worker.port=29998 -Dalluxio.worker.data.port=29999 -Dalluxio.worker.web.port=29996 -Dalluxio.worker.memory.size=16GB -Dalluxio.security.stale.channel.purge.interval=365d -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=SSD -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.path=/var/lib/docker/alluxio -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.quota=500GB -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.high.ratio=0.9 -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.watermark.low.ratio=0.7 -Dalluxio.home=/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT -Dalluxio.conf.dir=/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/conf -Dalluxio.logs.dir=/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/logs -Dalluxio.user.logs.dir=/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/logs/user -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=MEM -Dalluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.dirs.path=/dev/shm -Dlog4j.configuration=file:/opt/alluxio-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/conf/log4j.properties -Dorg.apache.jasper.compiler.disablejsr199=true -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Dalluxio.logger.type=Console,MASTER_LOGGER -Dalluxio.master.audit.logger.type=MASTER_AUDIT_LOGGER alluxio.master.AlluxioMaster </denchmark-code>
And I checked the getConf: <denchmark-code>/opt/alluxio/bin/alluxio getConf |grep alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias alluxio.worker.tieredstore.level0.alias=MEM </denchmark-code>
Looks like it's configured MEM in the end. I'd like to change SSD as the level0 tieredstore. Any suggestions on it? Thanks.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cheyang>@cheyang</denchmark-link> , were you able to make progress on this issue?
Yeah, I'm able to make it work now. Thanks.
